p.s: The given excerpt of the political speech by Michel Barnier at the European American Chamber of Commerce was delivered in New York on 10th July in 2018.

The EU commissioner for taking back negotiations of the UK in the course of Brexit holding the speech after having greeted the audience and having thanked for the opportunity to speak about his subject.
The political speech is about the consequences of Brexit, as well as the characteristics of a close relationship between the UK and the EU.
According to the speaker, Brexit will have negative consequences (ll. 2-3).
Now, trade will be no longer trouble-free (l. 5).
Subsequently, economic sectors, for example manufacturing, logistics, agricultural and food sectors will become a burden on value chains (ll. 6-8).
A close relationship between the UK and the EU concerns financial services.
The EU Single Market, as well as the free movement of capital, is open to third countries (ll. 16-18).
Moreover, the Free Trade Agreement with the UK includes to establish by lookinlooking forward certain EU rules (ll. 20-21).
A close relationship will be create if US companies have a leading role in EU markets (ll. 30-31).
The EU is the most open market.
This system continuecontinues to exist in the future in cooperation with the UK financial services (ll. 29-32).
To sum up, Brexit has a worst impact on the UK but the EU will work as its best nevertheless.
